result.execSummary:
The defendant Reynaldo Alvarez-Rebollar was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-THC(>200-1000g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)2.
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 2 years bifurcated sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Must have proper immigration papers in order to stay in the United States.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

Defendant Reynaldo Alvarez-Rebollar in court with attorney David Saldana.  Defendant Reynaldo Alvarez-Rebollar in custody.   Interpreter, Daniel Lopez, appeared on behalf of the defendant and was sworn previously today.
 Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.   The defense motion to sever is withdrawn.  The defense motion to compel disclosure of CI is heard.  Attorney Saldana makes his argument.  State argues it's position.  Attorney Saldana clarifies his position.  BTC:  The court will compel either the disclosure of information or an in camera conversation with CI.  Once that has been conducted the court will issue an order.  Judge feels the defense has met their burden re: the information they are requesting and an incamera conversation.  Motion for Discovery.  Defense has requested disclosure of 6 items.  Atty Saldana presents his argument.  ADA Riek presents her argument.  BTC:  release of the 6 items is dependant on the conversation with CI.  The court takes the motion under advisement.  There is nothing exculpitory. DST is filed with the court.   Review hearing scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Reynaldo Alvarez-Rebollar in court with attorney Mindy M. Nolan.  Interpreter services provided by Daniel Lopez.  Defendant Reynaldo Alvarez-Rebollar in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Reading of amended complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond remains as set on 5/21.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  No contact with the co-defendants. RR & FGS.   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
